image.altText: Smoke burning over homes

items.synopsis: An emergency warning is issued for two out-of-control bushfires in New South Wales which are threatening homes and properties.

title.children: Residents told it's too late to leave as two out-of-control bushfires are upgraded to emergency

image.altText: flames light up night sky behind houses

items.synopsis: Bushfire emergencies are unfolding in multiple states, with hundreds of firefighters battling blazes in VictoriaÂ while an emergency warning for Flinders Island in Tasmania's north-east has been downgraded. Follow live.

title.children: Fires in Victoria, NSW reach emergency level as Tasmanian fire downgraded

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: While fire conditions are expected to ease, there are now severe weather warnings for most of the eastern part of Victoria for heavy rainfall that could lead to flash flooding. The Bureau of Meteorology's Christie Johnson says 30 to 60mm of rain is expected to drench the area, and possibly even 70 to 80mm in parts of the ranges. She says a low pressure system will start to develop tomorrow which will bring more wet weather. "There is quite a lot of rainfall expected to fall over 6 to 12 hours,"Johnson says. "So even if it's not that heavy rainfall where you get a huge amount in a short time, it could still be enough to overwhelm gutters and give some flash flooding." Conditions are expected to be much clearer on Friday and into the weekend.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Flash flooding risk in Victoria's east today and tomorrow

children.content: While fire conditions are expected to ease, there are now
severe weather warnings
for most of the eastern part of Victoria for heavy rainfall that could lead to
flash flooding

props.alt: Meteorologist Christie Johnson addressing the media with a serious look on her face.

children.content: Meteorologist Christie Johnson says there are severe weather warnings for flash flooding and damaging winds.
(ABC News)
The Bureau of Meteorology's
Christie Johnson
says 30 to 60mm of rain is expected to drench the area, and possibly even 70 to 80mm in parts of the ranges.
She says a low pressure system will start to develop tomorrow which will bring more wet weather.
"There is quite a lot of rainfall expected to fall over 6 to 12 hours,"Johnson says.
"So even if it's not that heavy rainfall where you get a huge amount in a short time, it could still be enough to overwhelm gutters and give some flash flooding."
Conditions are expected to be much clearer on Friday and into the weekend.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A Watch and Act warning has now been issued for Cobbannah, Culloden, and Moornapa communities in Victoria. "It is strongly recommended that you prepare to evacuate," Victoria emergency services say. The bushfire at Duffy Rd, Briagolong, is not yet under control and is currently travelling in a south-easterly direction. However, it is expected to change direction to the north-east after the wind changes this afternoon. "While the change in weather has slowed the fire spread, there is still active danger in the landscape," Victoria emergency services say.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Victoria residents strongly advised to 'prepare to evacuate'

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Loch Sport fire is about 1 kilometre away from the township. CFA Incident Controller Andy Gillham says it's expected to reach the coastal town amid changing wind gusts this afternoon. "That fire has now changed direction and is moving in an easterly direction and is expected to continue to move east this afternoon towards the township of Loch Sport," he says. "We've asked people in Loch Sport this morning to stay where they are and shelter ... or move to a safe area." He says there's only one road in and out of Loch Sport which has been affected by fire. There is a temporary relief centre set up at the Loch Sport Marina. "If there are going to be impacts on Loch Sport, we expect the impacts to be on the immediate western end of town, and we've got lots of appliances from CFA and FRV and other agencies there to minimise any impact," Gillham says. "There's a very narrow strip of vegetation that lies between the main road and the lake itself, and there is potential for the fire to move right along that strip and it'll come very close to those backyards of those homes that lie on that strip." He says authorities are not expecting significant impacts but they want the community to be alert. Conditions are expected to ease after the cool change at around 5pm AEDT.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Wind change expected to bring fire closer to Loch Sport township

"There's a very narrow strip of vegetation that lies between the main road and the lake itself, and there is potential for the fire to move right along that strip and it'll come very close to those backyards of those homes that lie on that strip."
He says authorities are not expecting significant impacts but they want the community to be alert.
Conditions are expected to ease after the cool change at around 5pm AEDT.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The RBA's decision to keep rates on hold for another month has not helped the value of Australia's dollar. It's fallen again in the last hour and a half, and is now trading around 63.17 US cents.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australia dollar falls again

children.content: The RBA's decision to keep rates on hold for another month has not helped the value of Australia's dollar.
It's fallen again in the last hour and a half, and is now trading around 63.17 US cents.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Over to you â rates might be on hold for another month, but with the slight increase in monthly inflation, rising petrol prices and house prices gaining in value, there's lots of variables when it comes to interest rates and what could happen in the coming months at the RBA's next meetings. So, what do you want to know? Are you unsure why r ising oil prices are impacting the RBA's thinking, or are you curious about what the impending Christmas retail season might do to inflation ? Or is there something else about the economy that you want to know? Send us your questions using the blue comment button at the top of the blog and business reporter Gareth Hutchens will get to answering them soon.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: What do you want to know about the RBA's latest rates decision?

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Reserve Bank has left the cash rate on hold at 4.1 per cent for the fourth month in a row but has not ruled out future increases to return inflation to target. The decision leaves the cash rate at its highest level since April 2012. Tuesday's board meeting was the first chaired by Michele Bullock, who replaced Philip Lowe as the central bankâs governor last month.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: RBA leaves rates on hold for another month

Tuesday's board meeting was the first chaired by Michele Bullock, who replaced Philip Lowe as the central bankâs governor last month.
